0514SA001-d-05-03-14-UP.Narrative: MOTORIST DROVE NORTH ON THE LOOP 410 SERVICE ROAD AND FAILED TO TURN AND RAN HER RED HONDA ACCORD THROUGH UPRR TRACKS AT MP 8.6 ON THE CORPUS CHRISTI SUBDIVISION.  VEHICLE STRUCK THE TRACKS AT MP 8.6AND WENT OVER THE TRACKS COMPLETELY AND STOPPED IN THE WOODS BEYOND THE TRACKS.  THIS CAUSED UNANNOUNCED DAMAGE TO THE TRACKS.  THE BNSF LIGHT ENGINE MOVE, MHTSJJ-03 WITH UNITS CSXT3108 AND BNSF4903 MADE CONTACT WITH THE DAMAGED TRACK WHILE MOVING SOUTH AT MP 8.6, WHERE THE TRAIN DERAILED COMPLETELYTRAVELING 416 FEET. 0514SA026-d-05-30-14-UP.Narrative: WE RECEIVED A CALL FROM OUR INTERMODAL CONTRACTOR STATING THAT WE HAD JUST HAD A DERAILMENT AT SAIT.UPON INSPECTION AND INVESTIGATING, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT A SWITCH WAS OVERLOOKED WHEN SHOVING CARS FROM OUR 102 LEAD INTO A RAMP TRACK, 802.  ISALB-30 WAS OUT IN 103 AWAITING AN AIR TEST FOR DEPARTURE.  DUE TO TRAIN LENGTH, IT WAS FOULING THE EAST END OF 102.  CAR DEPT PROCEEDED TO LOCK OUT THE TRACK, BUT BECAUSE OF TRAIN LENGTH, COULD NOT LOCK OUT THE NORMAL SWITCHES.  CARMAN INSTRUCTED HIS ASSISTANT TO LINE THE Y SWITCH OUTSIDE THE GATE AGAINST MOVEMENT INTO 103 SO THEY COULD BE PROTECTED.IT WAS THEN DETERMINED BY THE COORDINATOR THAT THERE WAS STILL ROOM TO PULL THE TRAIN AHEAD A FEW MORE CARS TO CLEAR THE SWITCHES ON THE EAST END AND THAT THE CAR DEPT COULD LOCK OUT THE NORMAL SWITCHES.  ONCE ALL THE SWITCHES WERE CLEARED, THE CAR DEPT REMOVED THEIR LOCKS ON THE Y SWITCH, LEAVINGIT LINED AGAINST MOVEMENT, AND PUT THEIR LOCKS ON THE NORMAL SWITCHES FOR PROTECTION.  ONCE THE ISALB WAS DONE, SWITCH CREW HOPPED OVER TO 102 IN WHICH CARS WERE BEING STORED DUE TO THE THRESHOLD CAPACITY, AND BEGAN SHOVING BACK INTO THE YARD.  102 SWITCH WAS ALREADY LINED FOR MOVEMENT DUE TO ISALBPROTECTION SO THE CONDUCTOR PROCEEDED TO BRING 102 INTO THE YARD STOPPING HALF WAY AROUND THE CURVETO CHECK ROUTING INTO THE 802 TRACK.  CONDUCTOR DID NOT REALIZE THAT THE CAR DEPT HAD LINED THE Y SWITCH AGAINST MOVEMENT AND DROVE PAST THE SWITCH NOT REALIZING IT WAS LINED AGAINST HIM AND PROCEEDED

PSA570414D-d-05-21-14-PSAP.Narrative: ON MAY 21, 2014 AT 1858 HOURS, A PSAP TRAIN CREW WAS SHOVING 72 CARS EASTWARD INTO BLAKESLEE JUNCTION TRACK NO. 2 FROM THE MAIN TRACK. THE TRAIN CREW WAS ATTEMPTING TO SHOVE A CUT OF CARS DEEP INTO THE TRACK, CUTTING AWAY FROM SOME OF THEM LESSENING THE AMOUNT TO BE HANDLED, AND THEN PROCEEDING BACKOUT TOWARDS THE MAIN TRACK. THE CONDUCTOR WAS POSITIONED ON THE EAST END OF TRACK 1 PROTECTING THESHOVE HAVING THE BRAKEMAN POSITIONED AT THE CUT POINT AS THE DERAILMENT HAPPENED. THE INITIAL DERAILMENT OCCURRED DURING THE SHOVING MOVEMENT AS THE TRAILING END OF TTZX 856387 DERAILED NEAR THE MAINTRACK FROG TRAVELING OVER IT AND CONTINUING WITH A WHEEL INSIDE THE GAUGE OF TRACK NO. 1 AND ANOTHERON FIELD SIDE BETWEEN TRACK 1 AND THE MAIN TRACK. AFTER THE CREW MADE THE CUT IN THE CARS, MOVEMENTSTARTED BACK WESTWARD. AS TTZX 856387 TRAVELED WEST IT TRAVELED OVER THE TRACK 1 SWITCH AND OFF THEEAST SIDE OF THE RAIL AND TRAVELED DOWN THE LEAD TOWARDS THE MAIN TRACK SWITCH STAND, AND JUST BEYOND THE SWITCH HITTING THE GAUGE SIDE OF THE WEST MAIN TRACK RAIL CAUSING IT TO ROLL AND BREAK. AS THE MOVEMENT CONTINUED THE TRAILING CARS DERAILED AT THE BROKEN AND OVERTURNED RAIL. MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED BY THE DERAILMENT. THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT IS CONTRIBUTED TO MULTIPLE FACTORS, FIRST BEING THE LONG DRAW BAR EMPTY CENTER BEAMS MIXED WITH LOADS CAUSED EXCESSIVE LATERAL FORCES DURING THE INITIAL SHOVING MOVEMENT, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE TRACK GEOMETRY OF FOUR BACK TO BACK CURVES, ALL GREATE

815017-d-05-29-14-WC.Narrative: L58881-28 WAS SHOVING DOWNHILL WITH 3 ENGINES AND 3 LOADS, TO A COUPLING ON THE WYE AT THE TOMAHAWKRAILROAD. THEY WERE COUPLING A TRACK OF 26 CARS, CONSISTING OF 3 EMPTIES AND 23 LOADS WITH 5 HANDBRAKES APPLIED. THE ENGINEE STATE HE HAD FULL INDEPENDENT AND FULL AUTOMATIC SHOVING BACK TO THE COUPLING WHICH WAS IN A 13 DEGREE CURVE WHEN TTPX 70012, CC 40102, BLE 1622 AND WC 33024 DERAILED ACCOUNTA HARD COUPLING. THE TOMAHAWK RAIL ADVISED $22,666 IN TRACK DAMAGE.

WFA002-d-05-29-14-WFA.Narrative: ACCIDENT OCCURRED ON MAY 29TH 2014 AT APPROXIMATELY 1300 MST.  RESTRICTION FORM B WAS IN EFFECT ON THE LEE RANCH SUBDIVISION STARTING AT 0830 AND ENDING AT 1600 WITH LIMITS BEING BETWEEN M.P. 16 AND M. P. 24.  AT APPROXIMATELY 1230 MT. STATE CONTRACTING FOREMAN GAVE VERBAL PERMISSION TO THE WFA 603WEST WHICH WAS LOCATED AT M.P. 24.5 PROCEED THROUGH HIS LIMITS AT MAXIMUM AUTHORIZED SPEED SOUNDINGBELL AND WHISTLES ON ACCOUNT OF MEN AND EQUIPMENT ON AMBROSIA SIDING.  UPON GIVING VERBAL RECEIPT WFA 603 WEST PROCEEDED INTO FOREMAN LIMITS, WHILE DESCENDING A 1.8 % GRADE APPROACHING M.P. 17.5 AT 44MPH, WFA 603 WEST RECEIVED A RADIO TRANSMISSION VIA BNSF ROAD CHANNEL 3636, WARING TO MAKE AN EMERGENCY STOP ON ACCOUNT OF THE EAST SWITCH LEADING  TO AMBROSIA SIDING WAS LINED FOR OTHER THAN TRACK MOVEMENT UPON ACKNOWLEDGING THE TRANSMISSION WFA 603 WEST PUT THEIR TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY, WHILE STILLPROCEEDING WEST BOUND WITH TRAIN IN EMERGENCY AND USING FULL RETARDING FORCES I.E. DYNAMIC BRAKES,INDEPENDENT BRAKES, TRAIN AIR THE WFA 603 WEST CONTINUED THROUGH THE EAST END SWITCH OF AMBROSIA SIDING COLLIDING WITH MT. STATES CONTRACTING RAIL EQUIPMENT RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT OF ALL THE EQUIPMENT LOCATED ON THE SIDING WITH EXCEPTION OF ONE SPLINE CAR AND THE WFA 603 WEST TRAIN AND CONSIST.FINAL HEAD END LOCATION OF THE WFA 603 WEST WAS AT M.P. 17.2.  ASSESSED EQUIPMENT AT APPROXIMATELY$91,000.00, ASSESSED EQUIPMENT DAMAGE TO WFA 603 WEST TRAIN AND CONSIST IS ESTIMATED AT $15,000.00

051414-d-05-14-14-NYA.Narrative:
ON MAY 14, 2014 AT APPROXIMATELY 1459, CREW OF THE WESTBOUND NYA RS-40 REPORTED THAT THEIR TRAIN HADDERAILED AT THE EAST END OF TRACK 11 AT MP 9.4, ADJACENT TO HALL INTERLOCKING, JAMAICA STATION. POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS 30 INCHES EAST OF SWITCH #45 (THE WEST 10/11 SWITCH). THE REAR THREE (3) CARS OF THE SEVEN (7) CAR TRAIN DERAILED WITH A TOTAL OF TEN (10) WHEEL SETS ON THE GROUND. ALL THREE OF THE DERAILED CARS REMAINED IN AN UPRIGHT POSITION. APPROXIMATELY 450 FT OF TRACK WAS DAMAGED AS A RESULT OF THIS DERAILMENT. 

IT WAS APPARENT THAT THE #2 TRUCK OF THE 3RD CAR FROM THE REAR (ENVX 206214) WAS THE FIRST TO DERAIL WHEN THE LEFT (SOUTH) WHEEL CLIMBED THE RAIL, WITH THE LAST TWO CARS FOLLOWING SUIT.

MAXIMUM AUTHORIZED SPEED AT THIS LOCATION WAS 15 MPH. THE SPEED OF THE TRAIN AT THETIME OF THE DERAILMENT WAS 12 MPH INDICATED. HANDLING OF THE TRAIN BY THE ENGINEER WAS CARRIED OURPROPERLY AS PER THE AIR BRAKE AND TRAIN HANDLING RULES. THE CONDITION OF THE TRACK AT THE POINT OF DERAILMENT AND IN THE AREA IS FRA CLASS 2 WITH POOR DRAINAGE, THE GAUGE MEASURED 56.75 INCHES.

MEASUREMENTS TAKEN IN THE FIELD CONCERNING THE MECHANICAL CONDITION OF TRUCKS AND WHEEL SETS INVOLVED INDICATE ALL MEASUREMENTS WERE WITHIN REGULATED TOLERANCES. FURTHER INSPECTION OF THE TRUCKS AND WHEELS BY DISASSEMBLY WILL BE CARRIED OUT ON SHOP TRACKS AT FRESH POND.

09/15/2015 - DAMAGES UPDATED

000129497-d-05-05-14-CSX.Primary Accident Cause: Other general switching rules (Provide detailed  description in narrative)

000129497-d-05-05-14-CSX.Narrative: Y12105 HAD 17 CARS, 2 TANKS FOR YARA AND 15 CARS FOR ALCOA. THE FOREMAN STOPPED HIS TRAIN 10 CAR LENGTHS FROM THE YARA SWITCH AND THEN WALKED UP TO LINE THE SWITCH AND MAKE SURE THE DERAIL WAS DOWN. HE THEN WALKED BACK AND GOT IN POSITION TO WATCH HIS SHOVE. HE THEN LET THE ENGINEER KNOW HE WAS IN THE CLEAR, SWITCHES WERE LINED, DERAIL DOWN, AND TO COME BACK 15 CARS. HE THEN STOPPED THE MOVEMENT WITHIN 7 CARS BECAUSE THE CARS ON THE ADJACENT TRACK APPEARED TO BE IN THE FOUL. BEFORE THE MOVEMENTCOULD BE STOPPED THE CARS FOR YARA SIDESWIPED THE CARS ON THE ALCOA LEAD DUE TO THE INDUSTRY SHOVINGTHEIR CARS PAST THE CLEARANCE POINT AND FOULING THE YARA TRACK. THE REAR CAR OF THE SHOVE WAS DAMAGED AND THE LEAD CAR ON THE ALCOA LEAD IN THE FOUL WAS DAMAGED.

MAD0503143-d-05-03-14-IANR.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to apply sufficient number of hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
MAD0503143-d-05-03-14-IANR.Accident Cause: Failure to apply sufficient number of hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
MAD0503143-d-05-03-14-IANR.Narrative:
THE DERAILMENT/RAKING COLLISION OCCURRED ON MAY 3, 2014. ON SAID DATE, ONE LOADED CAR AND TWO EMPTIES ON TRACK 3 ROLLED OUT THE NORTH END OF THE TRACK AND SIDE SWIPED TWO CARS WHICH WERE SITTING ON THE MIDDLE LEAD TRACK. AS THESE TWO CARS WERE STRUCK THEY TIPPED OVER. THE CARS WERE EQUIPPED WITH SHELF COUPLERS WHICH SUBSEQUENTLY CAUSED FIVE ADDITIONAL CARS TO DERAIL. A TOTAL OF NINE CARS WERE FOUND DAMAGED WITH EIGHT DERAILED. 

FURTHER INVESTIGATION OF THE COLLISION DETERMINED THAT A CAR WASPLACED ONTO TRACK THREE WITH AIR ON THE CAR AND SUPPOSEDLY A HANDBRAKE WAS APPLIED. A FEW MOMENTS LATER TWO EMPTY CARS WERE KICKED INTO THE TRACK AT WHICH TIME THE CARS BEGAN TO ROLL NORTH WHICH CAUSED THE RAKING COLLISION WITH THE CARS SITTING ON THE MIDDLE LEAD.
